intro: Paraboea brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in short inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
